com.jmex.physics
Class PhysicsCollisionGeometry

java.lang.Object
  com.jme.scene.SceneElement
      com.jme.scene.Spatial
          com.jmex.physics.PhysicsCollisionGeometry
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.jme.util.export.Savable, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
PhysicsBox, PhysicsCapsule, PhysicsCylinder, PhysicsMesh, PhysicsSphere
public abstract class PhysicsCollisionGeometry
extends com.jme.scene.Spatial

Subclasses of this class are used to specify the physical geometry of a PhysicsNode. The physical geometry defines the collision bounds for the physics simulation. Advanced implementation may even use them for mass distribution of dynamic nodes.

PhysicsCollisionGeometries are created via the create* methods in PhysicsNode.

TODO: Cylinder, Cone, Capsule, TriMesh, Plane?, Ray?

Author:
Irrisor

getPhysicsNode

public PhysicsNode getPhysicsNode()
Returns:
the PhysicsNode this collision geometry belongs to

getMaterial

public Material getMaterial()
Query material of this geometry. If no material was set for this geometry the material of the physics node is returned.

Returns:
material used for this geometry, not null
See Also:
PhysicsNode.getMaterial()

setMaterial

public void setMaterial(Material value)
Change material of this geometry. If the same material is specified for a geometry as the physics node currently has the material of this geometry is inherited. The same applies if no material is set for a geometry.

Parameters:
value - new material
See Also:
PhysicsNode.setMaterial(com.jmex.physics.material.Material)

getVolume

public abstract float getVolume()
Query the volume of this geometry. Commonly used for mass calculation.

Returns:
the current value of this geometry

getCollisionEventHandler

public com.jme.input.util.SyntheticButton getCollisionEventHandler()
Creates a synthetic button that is triggered when this node collides with another node.

Returns:
a synthetic button that is triggered on a collision event that involves this node
